title: problem with folders and files with ã  ã© ã¨ in their names
body:
this is my environment:
server:windows 2012
database:mysql 5.5.28
client:1.1.3
oc-version:4.5.4
php-version:5.3.19

two faces of the same problem:

1) on owncloud web interface, when i create a new text document containing special chars  (like ã© ã  ã¨ or umlaut), the file is named with strange chars on the ntfs filesystem. for instance a file named 'tã©st.txt' on the web interface appears as 'tãƒâ©st' on ntfs.

2) on the local ntfs file system, when i create  a new text file containing special chars (like ã© ã  ã¨ or umlaut), owncloud crashes with this error: "[13-dec-2012 16:37:26 utc] php fatal error: uncaught exception 'pdoexception' with message 'sqlstate[hy000]: general error: 1366 incorrect string value: '\xe9.txt' for column 'name' at row 1' in d:\owncloud\web\cloud\lib\db.php:731"

i have written a post concerning this problem on the oc forum: http://forum.owncloud.org/viewtopic.php?f=3&t=7015

from what i have understood, the problem is not with mysql. the problem is between php code and ntfs: "the problem is that windows uses utf-16 for filesystem strings, whereas linux and others use different character sets, but often utf-8. you provided a utf-8 string, but this is interpreted as another 8-bit character set encoding in windows, maybe latin-1, and then the non-ascii character, which is encoded with 2 bytes in utf-8, is handled as if it was 2 characters in windows."
(source: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/1525 ... -8-strings)

i have also found other interesting readings that could explain this problem:
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/6634 ... 24#6634924
http://www.rooftopsolutions.nl/blog/fil ... ng-and-php

i think there are many other people with this issue because i am pretty sure i am not the first one to have windows as operating system and having files named with different sorts of accents (there are accents in italian words, french, german, etc).
